Text: how much hunting did you have to do to find rip software that puts out that file extension??????  Not worth the trouble to download.

@ aDruid  -  You are a Buffoon.  The file format is the very modern and widely used MPEG-2 Transport Stream container.  You will find this format on most nearly all Bly-Ray disks along with many others.

You were expecting .AVI ?   Hahahahahah.....
@aDruid You're a moron. m2ts is what's used *on the actual bluray*, it's extensively used. I guess you're not used to anything that's not .wmv.
